page.title: 09 ENTERTAINMENTS WOODBRIDGE
page.content: Woodbridge's two major entertainment places the{ Riverside Theatre} and the {Deben Swimming Pool}, attract people from Woodbridge itself, Ipswich and villages North of the area. The {Riverside Theatre} used to be Woodbridge Cinema, which has stood for 70 years. Today it seats 288 and shows films for 39 weeks each year, has a theatre 13 weeks every year and has a lovely restaurant open daily.It opened in May 1985. The most successful stage production was the{ Company of Four's} Razzle Dazzle. The{ Deben Swimming Pool} has been recently modernised too. Now it is covered and open all year round for the public and local schools. Woodbridge has a variety of {clubs}, the Woodbridge Youths Football team and the District Angling Club are popular. Lots of art and craft clubs meet regularly for adults.
